FuncDef: The test connectivity error-insert command injects bit errors into a PRBS bit stream during an enhanced PRBS connectivity test.
CLIs: test connectivity error-insert interface { <interface-name> | <interface-type> <interface-number> } { single-bit | insert-ratio <ratio-list> }

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an interface name.
The value is a string of 1 to 32 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies an interface type.
The value can be only a serial interface.

Specifies the ratio of injected bit errors.
The value is an integer that ranges from 2 to 10.

Examples: [~HUAWEI] test connectivity interface serial 3/0/0/0:1 nni-direction pattern PRBS20 hour 1 interval-repeat 20
[~HUAWEI] test connectivity error-insert interface serial 3/0/0/0:1 single-bit
[~HUAWEI] test connectivity error-insert interface serial 3/0/0/0:1 insert-ratio 5
[~HUAWEI] test connectivity error-insert abort interface serial 3/0/0/0:1
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
During an enhanced PRBS connectivity test, run the test connectivity error-insert command to inject bit errors into a PRBS bit stream. After bit errors are injected, check whether the number of injected bit errors are the same as that detected. If they are the same, the PRBS test is functioning properly.
To inject bit errors into a PRBS bit stream during a PRBS connectivity test, run the test connectivity error-insert interface command.
To stop injecting bit errors into a PRBS bit stream during a PRBS connectivity test, run the test connectivity error-insert abort interface command.
Prerequisites
An enhanced PRBS connectivity test has started using the test connectivity interface { uni-direction | nni-direction } command.
